__e: Actually, she said it was a shame she couldn't spend... what might be her last Thanksgiving with her family.

Oh! We're so sorry you're leaving.
- Well, it's a pity you're leaving.
A pity that my wife isn't here with us. I'm sure she would've liked it.
Shame that it's never the something I want you to want.
Too bad she couldn't be one of the 97 instead of one of the three.
Yeah, that was a shame about his wife.

"Gee, what a shame about your mother" or "How are you feeling?"
Yeah, that was a shame about his wife.
"Gee, what a shame about your mother" or "How are you feeling?"

It's a bummer, since I know that you and he are now close.

Well, that's a pity, because we aren't going anywhere.
But if he senses you're in there feeling sorry for him take it from me, that's the worst.
Oh yes I know, but I can't help feeling sorry for him.
I don't know if I feel sorry for him or if I just, you know...

The only reason she agreed to do this is because she's a nice person... and she feels sorry for you.
And that is why I have nothing but contempt for you.
Shame -- at who he is and what he's done.
And that is why I have nothing but contempt for you.

I don't feel that way-- sorry for myself.
